data.title: arithmetic operators for Color4F
data.body:
It is very intuitive and useful to be able to do component-wise and scalar arithmetic on float vectors that represent color.  This is already present and very useful in other color representations, such as GLSL's `vec4`.  This pull request allows for the following types of expressions:
```
auto blendedColor = colorA + colorB; // additively blend colorA and colorB
colorC /= 2.f; // halve the brightness and alpha of colorC, useful for fading
```
This expressive power makes more complex color calculations, like blending or interpolation, much easier to read and write:
```
Color4F interpolateTwoColors(const Color4F& a, const Color4F& b, float time) {
    return (b - a)*time + a; // same lerp formula as for simple data types
}
```

Similar operators could be useful for Color3B and Color4B, but they might end up being less intuitive and more unwieldy due to the high probability for integer overflow/underflow.

data.title: horizontal alignment support in RichText
data.body: RichText supports left, center, and right alignment. Added a button to the top of every test for changing the alignment.

data.title: Deadlock in WebSocket / Update libwebsockets to 2.2.0
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15
- devices test on: iOS
- developing environments
   - Xcode version: 8.3.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a WebSocket
2. Turn off the iPhone's screen
3. Wait 3 minutes
4. Turn on the iPhone
5. Call `WebSocket::close()`
6. Observe that the app is frozen

When the app is in the background the web socket may be disconnected without notifying the client code. If one tries to close `cocos2d::WebSocket` then a deadlock occurs. The issue is [fixed in libwebsocket](https://github.com/warmcat/libwebsockets/issues/809) in 2.2.0 by notifying the client code that the socket has been disconnected.

Please update the dependency to `libwebsocket` in Cocos2d-X to fix the issue.

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
HIGH energy consumption and GPU load on empty cocos2d-x starter project for iPhone6/6+. Probably more models affected.
data.body:
**Test Specs:**
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1
- devices test on: iphone 6, iphone6+
- developing environments
   - Xcode version:8.3.3 (8E3004b) but probably any version will have the same results.
   - iOS 10.x

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Download the latest Cocos2d-x v3.15.1
2. Run the cpp-empty-test iOS on iPhone 6 or iPhone 6+.
3. It should be at running at 60fps with 72 GL vests, 3 GL calls
![19688534_10154865388471872_951622678_o](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8600099/27770130-d348663a-5f41-11e7-8607-82fefaaa31eb.jpg)

4. Checking energy consumption using xCode. You will notice around 15% CPU (not an issue), that GPU is being used and a report for high energy consumption. 
![iphone high energy](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8600099/27770118-a3be3b06-5f41-11e7-8acc-efb84d9c81e5.png)

5. Repeat the test on iPad 3 or iPad mini. The energy consumption should be low and GPU is not being used. 
![ipad low energy](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8600099/27770120-a7a0c126-5f41-11e7-9256-3253975de96a.png)

Users have reported that phones are heating up while playing games powered by Cocos2d-x.

data.title: Debug and release builds cannot coexist in Linux when using the cocos console tool
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new project and get into the directory:
```
cocos new -l cpp build_coexist
cd build_coexist
```
2. Compile the project for debug mode:
```
cocos compile -p linux -m debug -j`nproc`
```
3. Compile the project for release mode:
```
cocos compile -p linux -m release -j`nproc`
```
4. Compile the project in debug mode again:
```
cocos compile -p linux -m debug -j`nproc`
```

And the whole building process will start from the beginning.

I'm aware I can just create another folder and use CMake to separate the builds and let them coexist, but it would be great if one could keep both builds when using `cocos` without having to recompile everything.

data.title: Moto G 5th gen exclusive error.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1
- devices test on: Motorola Moto G 5th Gen.
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r11C

App won't open on Motorola Moto G 5th gen with Android 7.0 or 7.1 ONLY.
Works on any Samsung S7, S8, Sony or ZTE.

This error could happen in more devices, but we catch it exclusively on Moto G 5th gen.
We tested with about 5 moto G devices, in 100% of the cases the app crashes on these.

data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1
- devices test on: OnePusX, Pixel C Tablet
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r11

I wanted to try VR and compiled the cpp-tests project. But the VR test shows a black screen on button click.

I also wanted to compile a newly created project with the gvr-sdk which failed to build (Android SDK is updated):

error: undefined reference to 'gvr_destroy_render_params_list'
undefined reference to 'gvr_get_recommended_render_params_list'
undefined reference to 'gvr_get_render_params'
undefined reference to 'gvr_create_render_params_list'

undefined reference to 'gvr_get_eye_from_head_matrix'
undefined reference to 'gvr_get_time_point_now'
undefined reference to 'gvr_get_head_pose_in_start_space'

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create new project with: `cocos new MyGame -p com.MyCompany.MyGame -l cpp`
2. Package: `cocos package import -v -b vrsdkbase --anysdk` I needed to patch AppDelegate.cpp manually
3. Package: `cocos package import -v -b gvr --anysdk`
4. Package: `python vrsdks/switchVRPlatform.py -p gvr-sdk`
5. Compile with Android Studio

data.title: RepeatForever and DelayTime
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: latest master branch (41ef696)
- devices test on: iphone simulator
- developing environments
   - Xcode version: 8.2

Steps to Reproduce:

```
some_node->runAction(cocos2d::RepeatForever::create(cocos2d::Sequence::create(
    cocos2d::CallFunc::create([] { CCLOG("AAA"); }),
    cocos2d::DelayTime::create(1.0f), nullptr)));
```
Problem:
- "AAA" is logged once.

Some investigation:
```
bool Sequence::isDone() const
{
    // fix issue #17884
    return (ActionInterval::isDone() && _actions[1]->isDone());
}
```
- `_actions[1]->isDone()` always returns false (`_actions[1]` is `DelayTime`).
